content:
John Terilla writes:

Dear friends,

To get a better understanding of the exciting new developments in quantum computing using tensor network techniques, Miles Stoudenmire and I organized a couple of events next week. The first is a tutorial on the subject on Tuesday, Nov 1 from 1:30 — 3:00. Miles is conducting the tutorial and he’ll give an overview of the fundamental ideas. The second event is a one-day symposium on Friday November 4, the program runs from 9:00am — 5:00pm.

Here are links to events with more information, including a registration form to register to attend in person at CUNY Graduate Center or virtually on Zoom (we’ll send a zoom link later).

https://itsatcuny.org/calendar/221104/tensornetworks-quantumcomputation
https://itsatcuny.org/calendar/tutorialtensornetworks/221101

Talks will be recorded and available later on the ITS Youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/@itsatcuny.

Sincerely,
John
